metadata.name: Primordial #225
metadata.description:
Primordial is a study of abstract forms. The algorithm, written in p5.js and WebGL, utilizes domain warping to create twisted fields of color and then overlays thousands of tiny lines to provide depth and texture. The outputs are chaotic but not completely formless, like a swirling mass of plasma from the early universe, or a strange proto-life form suspended in prehistoric ooze.

CONTROLS:

1-9: Increase resolution and save image in PNG format

B: Toggle borders on/off

F: Fullscreen
P: Portrait
L: Landscape
S: Square

For third party license information, please see license.md

David Brice Allen
October 2022

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #5648
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js

metadata.name: Triangularisme minimal #16
metadata.description:
Distribution of triangles on a grid

Press S to save a PNG file

##Very High Resolution
► Press 2 for X2 the resolution, be patient, then press S to save the image.
► Press 4 for X4 the resolution, be even more patient, then press S to save the image.

##Formats:
- Landscape
- Portrait
- Square

Made with p5js

metadata.name: Mount Doodle #13
metadata.description:
Tried my best to make every doodle aesthetically pleasing to the eyes.
However, just like nature, beauty often lies in imperfections. :)

Made with p5.js.
Primary split 5% with The Processing Foundation.

Keys
- 1: view 1000px png (Default)
- 2: download 2000px png
- 4: download 4000px png
- 8: download 8000px png
- s: save the image as PNG

When downloading higher resolution pngs, it might take several seconds to redraw the whole image. Download will start immediately after redrawing is completed. Please bear with the slow rendering.

metadata.name: WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition #239
metadata.description:
WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition is our official collaboration with Jeres, who was kind enough to work with us in support of the show. The project leans into classic Olympic poster design motifs, embellished by Jeres' signature approach to color and shape. Huge thanks to Jeres for donating their time and enthusiasm to this one, we hope you enjoy it!

As with all WTBS projects, your minting will directly support the podcast and keep us going (and more importantly, collecting!). Our goal is to keep the show free from ads and fully supported by the community, your donations and contributions continue to make that possible. Thank you in advance to everyone who chooses to mint!

Jeres: I love vintage posters. When going to second-hand shops, flea markets or wherever people are selling their used goods, I’m always on the lookout for what people used to hang on their walls. Bauhaus-inspired posters, socialist propaganda, Nagel prints, anything art deco, etc.. but whenever I come across something Olympics inspired I always feel like I hit pay dirt. There’s something about the clean, simple design being used to show people coming together along with the undertones of human excellence that just feels special. And circles. I love circles. I hope you enjoy this collection as much as I enjoyed putting it together with Trinity and Will.

Approximate rarity notes:
5%: Gold Edition
10%: Silver Edition
15%: Bronze Edition 

Commands in fullscreen mode:
S : Save current resolution
1 : Save 2000x3000px
2 : Save 4000x6000px
3 : Save 6000x9000px
4 : Save 8000x12000px
5 : Save 10000x15000px

(The higher the resolution, the longer it takes to render/save. use Chrome for best results.)

metadata.name: Garden of Imagination #38
metadata.description:
The more a garden can sharpen all senses, the better.

The garden is one of the most artistic expressions where the five human senses are explored (sight, smell, sound, taste and touch).
It's very good to be impressed by many different colors and shapes, feel the perfume of flowers, feel the textures of plants, taste the fruits and hear the noise of leaves and birds. The more a garden manages to sharpen all the senses, the better it fulfills its role.
The challenge of this project is to provide as many sensations as possible, some you will get visually and others you will need imagination. Imagination is an essential part of this project. There are different species from different cultures that, after becoming relatives, start to interact with each other.

The Garden of Imagination is layered artwork generated from a pool of previously rendered digital assets developed for several months.

- Use the "S" key to export an image.

metadata.name: what's left of what's left #17
metadata.description:
"The images is not a closed field of knowledge; it is a whirling, centrifugal field. It is not a fiedl of knowledge like any other; it is a movement demanding all the anthropogical aspects of being and time" Didi-Huberman

Continuing in the experimentation of photography and generative art.

What's left of what's left ... Seeks to take the reflection beyond the simple superimposition of images, highlighting the "human" x "machine" interaction.

The areas of light, fog and shadows present us with image clippings in a large tangle of visual reflections.

The algorithm builds unique images from the combination of different layers, according to a bank of photographs extracted from my own collection. In total, there are six layers containing 10 photographs each, in addition to a base layer containing 20 photos of urban fragments.

In addition, the code implements, in a random and semi-autonomous way, some adaptations such as masking, colorization, rotation and blending modes for specific layers.

* Features
Place - Where have i been. 20 distinct urban fragments;
Mode - “Color” 80% or “B&W” 20%;
Zone - “Amazon” 25%; “Mist” and “Terracotta” 20%, “Old Sky” 15%; and “Ocher” and “Golden” 10%.
Invert - 2.5%

"In a sense of overlapping past/future, not as an idea of ​​current time, but as places of memory dispute. This "non-place", traversed by layers, is solidified in the images, almost like a truce from the endless war of this inconstancy.
there is no winner" Raffa Gomes

Generative Token by of Morbeck for fxhash

august 21, 2022

metadata.name: adrift #111
metadata.description:
Take your entire life, full as it is with the vastness of your lived experiences – and shape it into your cupped hands. Cherish this mesmerising world of yours as you would a ripe summer fruit, and behold at a glance its delicate yet dynamic balance — one change here or there, no matter how microscopic, affects the entire course of your world. 

How will you receive this world – its situations that overwhelm, its sights that awe, the catastrophes, the serenity, its steadfast commitment to the present? Will you look upon all of us here, adrift and fragile together, with love?


Adrift is a project that reminds us to make peace with our world – with all worlds – by stepping back to make space for an all-encompassing perspective.


------------


Created by Jacek Markusiewicz @jMarkusiewicz
Creative collaboration with Tender @tender_art

Click on the image for resolution options and to save a .png file. Saving higher resolutions may not work in some browsers; in these cases, right-click-save the image. All drawing and geometric methods are written by mrkswcz using javascript, except for the following:

The pseudorandom terrain generation uses Hydraulic-Erosion by Sebastian Lague, inspired by "Reconnaissance" by TENDER x Nat Sarkissian (MIT License).

For finding paths that simulate connections in terrain and potential locations of cities, a C# script was adapted from the article "Pathfinding Algorithms in C#" by Kristian Ekman published in Code Project licensed under The Code Project Open License (CPOL). The code was translated to javascript and simplified for performance.

Many pseudorandom effects are achieved with perlin-simplex by David Guttman and seedrandom by David Bau (both MIT Licenses)

For more information, please see the bundle.js.LICENSE.txt file included in the package.

The "heat death" event is a small tribute to lunarean's fxhash project. The code that generates the disintegration effect interprets a fragment of lunarean's code. Further contributions are its adaptation for 3d transformations and its recursive character that modifies certain parameters over time.

The project uses CPU for calculations and rendering – generating the image requires up to 500MB of free RAM. Testing was performed across browsers and devices, but please make sure it works on your device before minting. Note that there are minor colour-intensity differences between different browsers.

metadata.name: Epiphany #215
metadata.description:
The real is manifested through the imagination, and the imagination is manifested through the spirit.
The way is this.
There is no randomness.

metadata.name: AI Brain Scheme #257
metadata.description:
Simple project using trigonometry, recursive function 
and simple geometry shapes to create an imaginary AI Brain Scheme

You can download the large image to see the small detail.

---
Features : 
AI Grid Configurator : True/False
AI Extra Brain Chips : True/False
Ai Binary Dreams Code : True/False
Photonic Wire : True/False

AI Level : 9 Levels (Very Small AI-Small AI-Medium AI-Medium x2 AI-Large AI-Large x2 AI-Impossible AI-Insane AI-Quantum Level AI)
"Quantum Level AI" = super rare

Color Schemes : red,blue,green
---
Unlimited colors palette
---
Press [p] to save captured image to png (3300pxx4500px)
---
Created using vanilla javascript
KrouniHatim - Oct22
---
(CC BY-ND 4.0)

metadata.name: in the void #27
metadata.description: Made with p5.js

metadata.name: 🔸WOMAN 🔹LIFE🔹 FREEDOM🔸 #775
metadata.description:
📅 To be recorded in history as the first event-based stamp collection of generative art on the blockchain. 

🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩
⬜️⬜️⬜️⬜️⬜️
🟥🟥🟥🟥🟥

🔆The people of my country – Iran - have been chanting three words for several days: 🔸Woman🔸🔹Life🔸🔸Freedom🔸.

🟢For over forty years, we have fought for these beautiful words. Today, our most basic human rights are being ignored in Iran, and we fight for them every day. In my land, women fight and die but do not accept humiliation. Women and men stand shoulder to shoulder and fight together.

🟢I published this collection of 1401 generative tokens to show my support for the people of Iran. 401 tokens are reserved for other known supporters of this cause, and 1000 tokens are free to mint.

🟢All my works about Iran's freedom are royalty-free and will always be. Due to fxhash's limitation on royalty selection, I have selected it all for the minter.

✅After completing the token animation, you can save the image in the following sizes and apply the following color filters: 

⌨️ SPACE key   ⏩ No Animation
⌨️ "r"   key   🔁 Reset All Filters
⌨️ "c"   key   ▶️  Random Tint Mode
⌨️ "g"   key   ▶️  Grayscale Mode
⌨️ "t"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Normal)
⌨️ "y"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Darker)
⌨️ "u"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Brighter)
⌨️ "i"   key   ▶️  Invert Mode
⌨️ "p"   key   ▶️  Random Posterized Mode

⌨️ Key number  1️⃣  1000✖️1000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  2️⃣  2000✖️2000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  3️⃣  3000✖️3000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  4️⃣  4000✖️4000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  5️⃣  5000✖️5000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  6️⃣  6000✖️6000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  7️⃣  7000✖️7000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  8️⃣  8000✖️8000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  0️⃣  16000✖️16000 pixels

🅿️5️⃣ Built with p5js

🔆Generative art by Arash

metadata.name: The City #281
metadata.description:
// The City //

Cities are the most complex human-made interventions on Earth. The human settlements are growing like huge organisms – and the growth is often impossible to plan, control or limit.
Cities as a phenomenon are with their incredible complexity highly enigmatic structures, that are as fascinating as they are terrifying.

This project is a study of the beauty of complexity.

Each city iteration is an entirely unique structure with unique hatching, arrangement of buildings, heights, sizes, additions and rare items.
The cities are made even more organic by the meticulous modelling of analog ink drawing.

The project is 100% generative. All lines, hatching and dots are generated for each iteration.

As a gesture of appreciation towards our supporters, 20% of royalties will go to the original minter.

Key commands:
Press 's' to save a png version
Press '2' to render at twice the resolution
Press 'b' to remove the colored background before saving

The loading progress is animated, hence the epileptic trigger warning.
Due to memory constraints on mobile devices, rendering uses a lower resolution on these.
-----------

Original concept by @Lax_raven
All code by @r1b2art

metadata.name: De Stijl #60
metadata.description:
This project is a playful attempt to depict how Neo-plasticism painters abstracted compositions, inspired and a tribute to the "De Stijl" movement, drawn using statically rendered block elements. The visual language reminds the original designs of famous artists of this art movement; in this project, each color palette is categorized by the name of a favorite piece of these artists. These palettes are sometimes determined by the color combination of this artist's works, which form the visual identity of their works from the color dimension.
In this project, different nodes are simple orthogonal shapes of color spots and thin lines to demarcate colors. I tried to create a dynamic effect by questioning the usual signs of vision in the abstract works of this period, to modify the relationship between them profoundly, and to show another field of my understanding of this movement by drawing a personal space.
The colors red, black, blue, and yellow were used from this turning point in the Neo-plasticism that the artists of the 'De Stijl movement cared about.
Subtle black lines separate the vast rectangles, which for some are filled with bright or black, or gray; each small component is a member to create a whole and a single visualization, and each aspect of the components receives its visual value from the whole.
This work has set 27 color palettes and three variations to shape different rarities. It is better to set the browser to standard mode to see the effect better.

De Stijl
 
The style "De Stijl" of the Dutch avant-garde movement is an essential key to understanding the sources of the modern movement. The movement is organized around three central figures: the painter Piet Mondrian and Theo van Doesburg and the furniture designer and architect Gerrit Rietveld. Other core members are the painters Bart van der Leck, Georges Vantongerlo, and Willmus Huzar; the architects J.J.P Oud, Robert van Hoff, and Jan Wills; the poet Anthony Cook, later the graphic designer Piet Zwart and the architect Cornelis van Stern.
In 1918, a year after the official founding of the group and publication of the magazine's first issue that published and publicized the movement's doctrine, the creators of De Stijl combined the aesthetic and social vision. The group's first manifesto calls for a new balance between the individual and the universal and fights to free art from the limitations of the cult of individualism. 
 
De Stijl originates both in the Hegelian tradition and in the Theosophical movement, then spreading in the Netherlands, both a utopian vision and a commitment to the production of the reality of the industrial world. However, it is a formal, plastic, pictorial, or architectural transcription of the principles of universal harmony that its creators implement. Painting, sculpture, furniture design, graphic design, architecture, and soon urban planning support this experiment, carried out simultaneously by different group creators. De Style productions naturally go beyond the traditional and academic division between primary and secondary arts, decorative arts, architecture, and urban planning.
From the realm of the mind to the city, this can be the guiding thread for the evolution of the Style's productions during its fourteen years of life. The spatial nature of the work of art gradually reaches from the status of supporting the analysis of the world to a factor in building the social and political environment of the city. In this way, the spatialization of the work forms an experience of the world, gives order to the world, and gives essence to society. 
The Style's priority is to invent an official language that responds to the challenges of the industrial society after World War I and outlines strategies for implementing the new social order.
The method of this vision is Neo-plasticism, which initially consists in radicalizing the approach of the contemporary avant-gardes.

In this way, the spatialization of the work forms an experience of the world, gives order to the world, and gives essence to society. 
The Style's priority is to invent an official language that responds to the challenges of the industrial society after World War I and outlines strategies for implementing the new social order.
The method of this vision is Neo-plasticism, which initially consists in radicalizing the approach of the contemporary avant-gardes.

metadata.name: BlockTrain Window #291
metadata.description:
You open a window,
And see a new horizon;
You hide the morning sun,
But the trip will never stop.
